decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: To comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved plans and documents:2454MS_FUL: H22454MS_FUL: SH32454MS_FUL: SH42454MS_FUL: SH52454MS_FUL: SH62454MS_FUL: SH72454MS_FUL: SH82454MS_FUL: SH92454MS_FUL: SH102454MS_FUL: SH112454MS_FUL: SH12Suds proformaPlanning statementEnergy statement Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

Prior to the commencement of any above-ground works, a full Design and Access Statement shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The DAS shall include:- Contextual character analysis.- Annotated elevations showing materiality and detailing (brick bond, mortar, window reveals, lintels, cornices);- 1:20 scale bay study of the front elevation.- Confirmation of brick sample panel for officer inspection.Reason: To ensure a high-quality design that is responsive to the local context, in accordance with Policies D3, D4 of the London Plan (2021), Core Policy 30 of the Enfield Core Strategy (2010), and Policies DMD6, DMD37 of the Development Management Document (2014).

Prior to the commencement of above-ground works, a Sustainable Technology Strategy shall be submitted and approved by the Local Planning Authority. This shall include:- Feasibility and specification for air source heat pumps (ASHP).- Design and layout for solar photovoltaic panels (if feasible).- Visual integration, noise attenuation, and servicing strategies.Reason: To optimise energy efficiency and contribute to borough-wide carbon reduction targets, in accordance with London Plan Policy SI2, Core Policy 4, and the Enfield Climate Action Plan.

Prior to occupation, a minimum of two secure, covered and accessible long-stay cycle parking spaces per dwelling shall be provided in accordance with the following criteria:- Step-free access with minimum 1.2m wide route.- Secure enclosure with British Standard lock or fob.- Located close to each unit's entrance.Reason: To promote sustainable transport and comply with London Plan Policy T5, DMD47, and Core Policy 25.

Prior to occupation, full details of refuse and recycling storage facilities shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Aunthority, This shall include:- 1 x 240L bin each for general waste, dry recycling, and organics per dwelling.- Storage located within 25m of the highway.- Screening and weather protection.Reason: To facilitate waste management and ensure compliance with Enfield Waste Guidance ENV 08/162 and DMD47.

Prior to above ground works,, details of all boundary treatments, including front gates, shall be submitted to and approved in writing. Gates shall be set back a minimum of 5m from the highway boundary.Reason: In the interest of pedestrian and highway safety, in accordance with DMD47 and Core Policy 24.

Prior to occupation, a Biodiversity Enhancement Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing. The plan shall include provision for at least two features, such as:- Integrated bird or bat boxes.- Insect habitat features.- Pollinator-friendly planting.Reason: To secure ecological net gain and compliance with London Plan Policy G6, Core Policy 36, and DMD78.

Prior to above ground works, a soft landscaping scheme shall be submitted and approved, including species list, layout plan, planting methods, and maintenance schedule.Reason: To enhance the appearance and ecological value of the site in accordance with DMD79 and Core Policy 30.

No development or site clearance shall commence until a Tree Protection Plan and Arboricultural Method Statement (in line with BS5837:2012) have been submitted to and approved in writing. These shall ensure the protection of all TPO trees and root zones during construction.Reason: To safeguard protected trees on site in accordance with DMD80-DMD84 and London Plan Policy G7.

No development shall commence until a Construction Management Plan has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The Construction Management Plan shall be written in accordance with London Best Practice Guidance and contain: o	A photographic condition survey of the public roads, footways and verges leading to the site;o	Details of construction access and associated traffic management;o	Arrangements for the loading, unloading and turning of delivery, construction and service vehicles;o	Arrangements for the parking of contractors' vehicles;o	Arrangements for wheel cleaning;o	Arrangements for the storage of materials;o	Hours of work;o	The storage and removal of excavation material;o	Measures to reduce danger to cyclists;o	Dust mitigation measures;o	Membership of the Considerate Contractors Scheme. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved Construction Management Plan unless otherwise agreed by the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To ensure construction does not lead to damage of the nearby public road network and to minimise disruption to the neighbouring properties.

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015, no development shall be carried out under Classes A, B, or C of Part 1 of Schedule 2 (extensions, roof alterations, dormers) without express planning permission.Reason: To retain control over future development and protect the character and amenity of the area, in accordance with DMD6 and Core Policy 30.

Prior to the commencement of development, details of a Sustainable Drainage Strategy shall be submitted toand approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and must conform with the Landscaping Strategy. The details shallinclude:o	Results of infiltration testing to determine the applicability of full and partial infiltration. If infiltration is not deemed acceptable through infiltration testing an appropriate attenuation feature must be provided in line with the London Plan Drainage Hierarchyo	Final sizes, storage volumes, invert levels, cross-sections and specifications of all SuDS measures including rain gardens, permeable paving, and soakawayso	 Management Plan for future maintenanceReason: To ensure the sustainable management of water, minimise flood risk, minimise discharge of surface water outside of the curtilage of the property and ensure that the drainage system will remain functional throughout the lifetime of the development in accordance with Policy CP28 of the Core Strategy, DMD 61, and Policies 5.12 & 5.13 of the London Plan and the NPPF
